original_text:
Chicken Hatch
Per quanto riguarda l’esperienza italiana delle slot machine, c’è un animale che in particolare rappresenta con forza questo mondo. Non il drago con la sua tana piena d’oro, non la fenice simbolo di rinascita e nemmeno l’unicorno simbolo di fortuna… la gallina.
Nei bar di tutta Italia, infatti, nei primi anni duemila si trovava sempre la stessa slot con le galline e questo animale (che fa parte anche della quotidianità nelle realtà più rurali) è rimasto nel nostro cuore. La Capecod, consapevole della tradizione italiana, offre il titolo Chicken Hatch, dove potremo dare la caccia alla gallina dalle uova d’oro per portarci a casa un discreto gruzzolo.
Andiamo quindi a vedere cosa ha da offrirci questa slot.
Chicken Hatch: analisi visiva
Da un punto di vista prettamente grafico e musicale, la slot Chicken Hatch dimostra di essere semplice ma comunque di buon gusto: i simboli che compongono la griglia di gioco richiamo la realtà contadina tipica di una fattoria. Troviamo quindi pulcini, galline e galli, ma anche carrette, ortaggi e il temibile lupo.
Un aspetto che colpisce l’attenzione è l’attenzione ai dettagli: come in altre slot online, anche in questo caso tra i vari simboli troviamo quelli delle carte da gioco (A, K, Q…) ma, per non allontanarsi troppo dal tema, questi simboli vengono mostrati in modo estremamente particolare.
Ecco quindi che l’asso diventa due pannocchie che si toccano in alto o il jack diventa una melanzana dalla forma insolita. Un piccolo dettaglio molto apprezzato da chi valorizza il comparto visivo di una slot machine.
Chicken Hatch: come giocare
A inizio gioco viene proposta una scelta su cosa il giocatore voglia collezionare. Da una parte troviamo dieci uova, dall’altra invece cinque galline. Quale che sia la nostra scelta, il completare il contatore selezionato ci permetterà di accedere al bonus finale, una sfida difficile ma non impossibile.
Concentrandoci invece sugli aspetti più basilari di questo titolo, quella che ci troviamo di fronte è una slot che sfrutta il meccanismo 5*3 (come la maggior parte dei giochi della Capecod) e che presenta venti linee di vincita.
Data la possibilità di ottenere il bonus cumulativo, non sorprende che all’interno della griglia di gioco si trovino numerosi simboli speciali. Partiamo proprio dalle uova e la gallina bianca: questi simboli speciali permettono di aumentare il contatore, ma questo avverrà solo trovandone almeno tre in una singola giocata. Si parla quindi di simboli Scatter, proprio come il cesto di uova che ci permette di accedere ai giri gratuiti.
Un altro simbolo speciale è lo spaventapasseri: non solo questo è un simbolo Wild, ovvero un jolly che può sostituire tutti gli altri per elargire interessanti combinazioni, ma questi si può estendere su tutto il rullo.
In base alla nostra esperienza, la modalità bonus che viene innescata trovando le uova o le galline è sicuramente interessante (in cui vengono assegnati cinque tentativi che possono darci dei bonus casuali) ma trovare questi simboli è molto difficile (nel nostro primo tentativo abbiamo ottenuto un su dieci in circa cinquanta giri della slot). È però giusto precisare che le vincite durante questi giri non sono state rare, il che ha reso la nostra ricerca del bonus finale meno tediosa.
Slot simili a Chicken Hatch
Parlando di galline e uova d’oro, non possiamo non citare la famosissima Fowl Play Gold della Merkur o ancora Golden Egg of Crazy Chicken della Gamomat (quest’ultima offre il medesimo tema in modo un po’ alternativo).

raw_translation.response:
Chicken Hatch

In the Italian experience of slot machines, there is one animal that particularly represents this world with force. Not the dragon with its den full of gold, not the phoenix symbol of rebirth, and not even the unicorn symbol of luck... the chicken.

In bars throughout Italy, in the early 2000s, there was always the same slot with chickens, and this animal (which is also part of everyday life in rural areas) has remained in our hearts. Capecod, aware of Italian tradition, offers the title Chicken Hatch, where we can hunt for the chicken with golden eggs to take home a decent amount of cash.

Let's see what this slot has to offer.

Chicken Hatch: visual analysis

From a purely graphical and musical point of view, the Chicken Hatch slot proves to be simple but still tasteful: the symbols that make up the game grid refer to the typical farming reality of a farm. We find chicks, hens and roosters, but also carts, vegetables, and the dreaded wolf.

One aspect that catches the attention is the attention to detail: like in other online slots, in this case, among the various symbols, we find those of the playing cards (A, K, Q...) but, to not deviate too much from the theme, these symbols are shown in an extremely particular way.

So the ace becomes two cobs that touch at the top or the jack becomes an eggplant of an unusual shape. A small detail that is appreciated by those who value the visual component of a slot machine.

Chicken Hatch: how to play

At the start of the game, a choice is offered on what the player wants to collect. On the one hand, there are ten eggs, on the other, five chickens. Whatever our choice, completing the selected counter will allow us to access the final bonus, a difficult but not impossible challenge.

Focusing instead on the more basic aspects of this title, what we are facing is a slot that uses the 5*3 mechanism (like most Capecod games) and has twenty pay lines.

Given the possibility of obtaining the cumulative bonus, it is not surprising that many special symbols are found within the game grid. Let's start with the eggs and the white hen: these special symbols allow us to increase the counter, but this will only happen by finding at least three in a single game. We are therefore talking about Scatter symbols, just like the basket of eggs that allows us to access free spins.

Another special symbol is the scarecrow: not only is this a Wild symbol, that is, a joker that can replace all the others to give interesting combinations, but it can also extend across the entire reel.

Based on our experience, the bonus mode triggered by finding eggs or chickens is certainly interesting (in which five attempts are assigned that can give us random bonuses), but finding these symbols is very difficult (in our first attempt, we got one out of ten in about fifty spins of the slot). However, it is fair to say that winning during these spins was not rare, which made our search for the final bonus less tedious.

Slots similar to Chicken Hatch

Speaking of chickens and golden eggs, we cannot fail to mention the famous Fowl Play Gold from Merkur or Golden Egg of Crazy Chicken from Gamomat (the latter offers the same theme in a slightly alternative way).

Chicken Hatch: An Italian Slot Game

Chicken Hatch is a popular slot game in Italy that is centered around chickens and their daily life on a farm. The game is developed by Capecod Gaming, and it offers an interesting twist to the conventional online slot game.

Gameplay Features

Chicken Hatch is a 5-reel, 3-row online slot game that comes with 20 paylines. The game features symbols that are inspired by rural life, such as hens, chicks, roosters, carts, vegetables, and the fearsome wolf. The symbols of playing cards, A, K, Q, are also part of the game, but they are shown in a unique way to stick to the theme of farming.

Bonus Modes

Chicken Hatch offers various special symbols that increase the player's chances of winning. The eggs and the white hen are scatter symbols that give the player an opportunity to increase the counter. The basket of eggs is another symbol that grants free spins if the player gets a minimum of three in a single play. The scarecrow symbol is a wild symbol that can replace others to give the player better combinations and extends across the entire reel. The game also involves a final bonus, where the player has to collect either ten eggs or five hens to access the final bonus – a challenging but not impossible task. During this bonus mode, the player has five attempts that could grant them random bonuses. However, these symbols are not easy to come by, and the bonus mode is difficult to trigger.

Visual Analysis

The visuals of Chicken Hatch are simple but tasteful. The symbols used in the game grid brilliantly reference the farming reality of a farm, and great attention to detail is evident in the visuals. The game also features a great soundtrack that adds a pleasant ambiance to the game.

Similar Slots to Chicken Hatch

If you enjoyed Chicken Hatch, you might also like Fowl Play Gold by Merkur or Golden Egg of Crazy Chicken by Gamomat. Both slots feature a familiar theme of golden eggs and chickens with an alternative twist to the gameplay.

Review: Chicken Hatch
When it comes to the Italian experience with slot machines, there is one animal that particularly represents this world with strength. Not the dragon with its treasure trove, not the phoenix symbolizing rebirth, and not even the unicorn symbolizing luck... the chicken.
In bars all over Italy in the early 2000s, you could always find the same slot machine with chickens, and this animal (which is also part of rural daily life) has remained in our hearts. Capecod, aware of the Italian tradition, offers the title Chicken Hatch, where we can hunt for the golden egg-laying chicken and bring home a decent sum.
Let’s see what this slot has to offer.
Chicken Hatch: Visual Analysis
From a purely visual and musical standpoint, the Chicken Hatch slot proves to be simple but tasteful: the symbols that make up the game grid reference the typical farming reality of a farm. We find chicks, hens, and roosters, but also carts, vegetables, and the fearsome wolf.
One aspect that catches the attention is the attention to detail: as in other online slots, in this case, among the various symbols we find those of playing cards (A, K, Q...) but, in order not to stray too far from the theme, these symbols are shown in an extremely particular way.
Here the ace becomes two cobs touching each other at the top or the jack becomes an oddly shaped eggplant. A small detail much appreciated by those who value the visual aspect of a slot machine.
Chicken Hatch: How to Play
At the start of the game, the player is given a choice of what they want to collect. On one side, we find ten eggs, on the other hand, five hens. Whatever our choice, completing the selected counter will allow us to access the final bonus, a difficult but not impossible challenge.
Focusing instead on the more basic aspects of this title, what we find in front of us is a slot that uses the 5*3 mechanism (like most Capecod games) and presents twenty paylines.
Given the possibility of obtaining the cumulative bonus, it is not surprising that numerous special symbols are found within the game grid. Let's start with the eggs and the white hen: these special symbols allow you to increase the counter, but this will only happen by finding at least three in a single play. We are therefore talking about Scatter symbols, just like the basket of eggs that allows us to access the free spins.
Another special symbol is the scarecrow: not only is this a Wild symbol, that is, a joker that can replace all others to give interesting combinations, but it can also extend across the entire reel.
Based on our experience, the bonus mode triggered by finding the eggs or hens is definitely interesting (in which five attempts are granted that can give us random bonuses) but finding these symbols is very difficult (in our first attempt, we got one out of ten in about fifty spins of the slot). However, it is worth noting that the winnings during these spins were not rare, which made our search for the final bonus less tedious.
Slots similar to Chicken Hatch
Talking about chickens and golden eggs, we cannot fail to mention the famous Fowl Play Gold by Merkur or Golden Egg of Crazy Chicken by Gamomat (the latter offers the same theme in a slightly alternative way).
